criteria: Ability to accurately set up a quadratic function that models the problem
Ability to interpret the components of the quadratic function (coefficients, constants) in the context of the physical problem.
Ability to use the quadratic function to solve for unknowns related to the physical problem (e.g., time, height, distance).
descriptions: Student is unable to set up a function at all.
Student attempts to set up a function but it doesn't correctly model the problem and does not label the variables.
Student sets up a function with significant errors, and labels variables correctly
Student sets up a function with minor errors that models the problem, but does not simplify it. Variables are properly labeled
Student sets up a function that accurately models the problem, but does not simplify it. Variables are properly labeled
Student sets up a fully simplified function that accurately models the problem. Variables are properly labeled
Student cannot identify any components or relate them to the problem.
Student identifies components but provides incorrect interpretations or struggles to connect them to the physical problem.
Student identifies most components but misinterprets some or provides vague connections to the physical problem.
Student correctly identifies and interprets most components, providing clear connections to the physical problem.
Student correctly identifies and interprets all components, providing clear and accurate connections to the physical problem.
Student provides insightful and nuanced interpretations of all components, demonstrating a deep understanding of their relationship to the physical problem.
Student cannot use the function to solve for any unknowns.
Student attempts to solve for unknowns but demonstrates a lack of understanding of the appropriate methods or makes significant errors.
Student solves for some unknowns with errors or uses inefficient methods.
Student solves for most unknowns correctly, using appropriate methods with minor errors.
Student solves for all unknowns correctly, using appropriate methods with clear and accurate calculations.
Student demonstrates mastery in solving for unknowns, employing efficient methods and providing clear explanations of the problem-solving process.
